name: mattfish
text: A comment left by mattfish was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by joeyramoney, TwoRightFeet, Lokiamis, morbo)

name: superliminal
text: Sounds like an Of Montreal song. Not enough alliteration though.

name: phoenixultima
text:
"FINISH HIM!"
*shove*
"YOU WIN! GAYTALITY!"

name: mortshire
text:
"GAY".O.

vergiss mir.

name: catachresis
text: Oh boy, I was already laughing hard enough at that panel but you made me snort

name: heavymetaljesus
text: I think Onstad was planning for somebody to post this, it was all part of the grand scheme.

name: soticoto
text: VICTOLY!

name: sweetlips
text: Broken Pixels much?

name: capslock_annliv
text:
The first time I saw this comment, I thought it was amusing, but didn't necessarily deserve its 154 chubbies. The whole next day, the word "GAYTALITY" kept repeating itself in my head, and every time I cracked up.

Sir, you deserved this chubby.

name: duperando
text: Yes, this truly made me chortle. And every time I have re-read this strip, and I come across this comment, I always have a laughing relapse. And I have perused the achewood archives several times.

name: niggar
text: What happened to this storyline.

name: retardo
text: A comment left by retardo was marked as spam and excluded. retardo: What a douche. (reported by BlueWindow, mistlethrush, davidadam)

name: gusplease
text: This one made me laugh until I had tears in my eyes.

name: soticoto
text:
I'm still trying to stop.
I'm in the bloo a bloooo bloooo stage of laughter.

name: saint
text: A comment left by saint was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ButterMoths, riotdejaneiro, craigola, bug, Zem, gkiyo)

name: billyamericana
text: we better delete that one with all the lens flares pronto T yes i know you got the opacity just right dogg but you know its got to be done

name: phthoggos
text: The amazing thing is that Onstad just photoshopped the previous strip into this one, just like Beef and T.

name: unsentletter
text: "Photoshop says otherwise!"

name: riazm
text: They got no chops on this device (computer)

name: cpnglxynchos
text: they got no chops on this device (making Gay porn)

name: epicurus
text: The last three panels get this one much praise from me.

name: nurdbot
text: I praise them all. My favourite however, is YOU WIN.

name: leon_sumbitches
text: lollollol... I am still trying to figure out what they were trying to do in frame three!

name: vreeeee
text: Oh man, how the hell did I miss this strip the first time around?  Everything makes more sense now, knowing that there is no longer an Achewood strip I haven't seen, and that it includes a naked dude pyramid.

name: zerobot
text: Theodore has a nice editing set up there.

name: earendil
text:
This is rated waaaay too low. This is the strip that made me laugh the most of any one.
Especially being a Yale man myself...
I wonder what the "family business" is?

name: jips
text:
Indeed! I've never laughed so uproariously at a web comic. This comic sold me on Achewood.

Family business? Likely something to do with that long tongue...industrial scale stamp-lickers?

name: ibetso
text: I'm not sure Teodor will be doing this editing job for long... http://achewood.com/index.php?date=10162002

name: snowman
text: panel 7 gets this one a 5 for me

name: vincentkv
text: How come they aren't using the "There is no false power in the universe" pose?

name: brianx
text: This, to me, remains easily one of the funniest Achewoods ever. It's like Beef and Teodor are just subconsciously incapable of taking it seriously.

name: drago25
text: This is pretty much what happened when I was trained to use Avid.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Pat: SOYTOPIA: A SOCIOPOLITICAL AND ECOLOGICAL CLARITY BAR!
Onstad: The San Francisco Giants Season Opener.

"I'm going to drop a V-bomb and your business will go up in an eco-friendly, smokeless pyre fueled by organically ruined dreams."

name: deptford
text:
Holy God. This isn't the most subtle or literary comedy Achewood's ever had, but the sheer, devastating hilarity of every panel starting with the third made me laugh more than any other strip so far.

You're an angel, Onstad. And this comic is a beautiful gift.

name: seymourglass
text: In panel 2, Téodor expresses a general dismay that is the sentiment of so many projects that were great on the drawing board, but somehow never seem to pan out in practice.

name: jbushnell
text: This one can make me laugh until tears are in my eyes.  "We don't have any idea what we're doing, and I don't think it would matter if we did" is priceless in and of itself.

name: theguitarhero
text: This is probably my favorite strip of all time.

name: fermatprime
text: Seconded. Almost every single panel of this can make me literally laugh out loud, plus the alt text.

name: theguitarhero
text: I was reading it in class the first time, and was trying to stifle a chuckle. I showed it to a friend and he laughed too.

name: tonyhighwind
text: The eighth panel touches something primal in my heart.  I have to believe that anyone who considers themselves a gamer feels the same way.

name: ppccd
text: they got no chops on that device

name: puguglypress
text: This arc is what it feels like to do a project for school at the last minute, and you've obviously failed and just need to accept the F.

name: vulpes-aurum
text:
[IMGS OFF]

I WON!

name: pie4me6
text: Did you beat Super Luigi 128's account into submission?

name: dartigen
text: Onstad needs to warn people about the dangers of eating and drinking while reading Achewood. With that being said, inhaling a mouthful of tea is very good for clearing the nasal passages.
